meanings.definition: A person who makes a formal and legally binding promise to do or provide something.
meanings.sent1: The warrantees of the company assured customers of quality service.
meanings.sent2: The warrantees on the contract were responsible for fulfilling the commitments.
meanings.sent3: The warrantees at the store joked about guaranteeing sunny weather for the weekend.
meanings.sent4: She was a warrantees of happiness, always ensuring smiles on everyone's faces.
meanings.sent5: The warrantees of the team's success was the coach's dedication and hard work.

meanings.definition: A written guarantee promising to repair or replace a product if it breaks or malfunctions within a certain period of time.
meanings.sent1: The electronic device came with a warranty that warrantees free repairs for a year.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to keep the warrantees safe in case you need to claim a replacement.
meanings.sent3: The warrantees on the toaster were so confident, they dared it to break down.
meanings.sent4: The warranty warrantees peace of mind to the buyers, knowing they are covered.
meanings.sent5: The warrantees on the car ensured the buyer of its reliability and durability.
